description:
Passage one Questions 1 to 5 are based on the following passage.
In order to learn a foreign language well, it is necessary to overcome the fear of making mistakes. If the primary goal of language use is communication, the mistakes are secondary consideration that may be dealt with gradually as awareness of those mistakes increases. On the other hand, students should not ignore their mistakes. The language learner may observe how native speakers express themselves, and how native expressions differ from the way the learner might say them. For example, a Spanish speaker who has been saying “ I do it” to express willingness to do something in the immediate future, could, by interacting with native speakers of English, observe that native speakers actually say “I’ll do it”. The resulting discrepancy(差异) can serve as a basis for the student to modify his way of using the present tense in English. But a student who is unwilling to interact in the first place would lose this opportunity to learn by trial and error.

subQuestions.description: According to the passage, foreign language students should not worry too much about making mistakes because ________

options.label: A
options.description: native speakers will ignore their mistakes

options.label: B
options.description: communication is the primary goal of language learning

options.label: C
options.description: native speakers like foreign students who try to learn their language

options.label: D
options.description: everyone makes mistakes when trying to communicate in a strange language

subQuestions.description: The passage indicates that the present tense in English is _________

options.label: A
options.description: basically the same in English as it is in Spanish

options.label: B
options.description: not the most difficult problem for foreign students

options.label: C
options.description: not used to express a desire to do something in the immediate future

options.label: D
options.description: used with some verbs but not with others to express future intention

subQuestions.description: The author thinks that language learners can reduce the number of their mistakes by _____

options.label: B
options.description: reading good books in the foreign language

options.label: C
options.description: speaking without regard to native speakers

options.label: D
options.description: comparing their speech with that of native speakers

subQuestions.description: The passage implies that foreign students who do not interact with native speakers will not ___.

options.label: A
options.description: have to worry about making mistakes

options.label: B
options.description: learn very much about the foreign culture

options.label: C
options.description: learn about the history of the foreign language

options.label: D
options.description: take advantage of available language models

subQuestions.description: The author's major conclusion about the function of mistakes in foreign language learning is that_____ .

options.label: A
options.description: mistakes do not interfere with communication

options.label: B
options.description: learners are often very afraid of making mistakes

options.label: C
options.description: mistakes are not important in the process of learning a language

options.label: D
options.description: making mistakes can help the learner discover the rules of the language
